intro: Spermacoce rosmarinifolia, commonly known as rosemaryleaf spurredia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that resemble those of rosemary. Spermacoce rosmarinifolia typically grows as an erect or prostrate herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a useful plant for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
